TopicTitle: [Suggestion] Multiple Orbiting Celestial Objects in Kerbins Gravatational Field.

Articles.Content: I was thinking about adding more than just the Mun near Kerbin. I was thinking something like a small asteroid or spherical body about 1/3 the size of the mun. further out than the mun is. The reasoning behind this? Training at going further distances and landing on an object with much less gravity than we have gotten used too. it would make for more variety of missions than we can currently do. Also I would suggest having its orbit reversed to the muns, for diversity and so the mun can effectively be used as a staging point, again making things interesting. I would hope for things like this even in the final with the whole solar system, because it makes kerbin\'s AO more interesting and playable. Anyone have any thoughts on this? Like it hate it?

I like it. Would be very interesting indeed!

If we\'re on the subject of asteroids, why not also include things like comets that come in close vicinity to Kerbin every few years or so
No clue if asteroids will be added but planets will but lets focus on get docking working to make trips like these worth it. Anyway shouldn\'t this be Dev section?

shoot, i thought it was... well darn, I don\'t think I can move it can I?

And in response to what you said. I wasn\'t meaning this to be .15 imminent but maybe .16 .17. something for us to get while they work out tougher, longer things...throw the dogs a bone while you get their food ready I guess.
After thinking about it a simple reverse orbit at 0 degree\'s is rather bland and boring. I think a 30-45 degree Inclination would be much much better 8)
